table.name: Weird Magic Table
rows: The spell lasts twice as long
If the spell requires concentration it no longer does, if it didn't it now does.
The spell targets the caster instead. If the spell already targeted the caster it instead targets the creature closest to it.
The spell will only activate in 1d4 rounds at the start of the caster's turn.
The spell is cast using the spellcasters Strength as the spellcasting ability instead.
You gain the ability to cast the spell once within the next minute.
The target(s) of the spell get teleported 30 feet in a random direction.
The target(s) of the spell also regain hit points equal to the caster's spellcasting ability modifier.
The target(s) of the spell also take psychic damage equal to the caster's spellcasting ability modifier.
Any damage/healing dice that would be rolled during the casting of the spell get replaced by d4s
Any d20s that would be rolled during the casting of the spell get replaced by 2d10.
The spell summons a random creature of the DMs choice with a CR equal to the spell level. It has a random alignment.

table.name: Snack Summon Table
rows: (Requires a Tier 1 Fey Orenth Trait) You can cast the Summon Undead spell instead.

table.name: Messed up Time Table
rows: You become 3d10 years younger to a minimum of 1 year.
A future version of you appears, whose only goal is to make sure his timeline doesn't come to pass.
Your speed doubles, but you must use up all your movement every turn to run in a straight line.
Any non-magical armour or weapon on you are carrying takes a -2 penalty
Any non-magical armour or weapon returns to its original raw form (iron ore/silver ingot/a cow)
Your perception of the world is delayed. Every turn you must announce what you want to do in that moment, but it will only happen on the next turn.
Time freezes, and you become paralyzed. At the end of every day spent in this state you may repeat the saving throw.

table.name: Martial abilities
rows: They must meet the requirements for sneak attack to apply
Whenever they use your divine smite, it still costs your spell slots.
The wielder of the weapon uses favored foe as if they were the one using the feature.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Chaos
entries: Whenever you roll a 1 on an attack roll you may choose to hit instead, but you also take the damage your attack dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Chaotic Failure
entries: Once per long rest when you roll a 1 with a d20 you can forgo gaining inspiration and instead roll on the {@table wild magic surge|phb} table. If the effect would result in you regaining all your sorcery points, you can instead regain the highest level spellslot you have spent or a hit die.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Chaos
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest in an area with a lot of Chromatic Orenth of a different element, you may choose to become the genasi associated with that element instead. Additionally once per Short Rest when a creature within 60 feet of you takes fire, lightning, poison, acid or cold damage you may use your reaction to deal an additional 2d4 damage to them. Both of the damage dice are of different elemental kinds of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Prismatic Breath
entries: Whenever you use your breath weapon, you may choose to deal any type of Elemental Damage.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Flame
entries: Whenever you crit on an attack roll you may deal an additional 2d6 fire damage to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Spores
entries: Whenever you crit on an attack roll you may also deal 1d8 psychic damage to the target and any creature within 5 feet of them.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Poison
entries: When you deal poison damage you may also deal 1d4 psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Secret Detection
entries: You have advantage Insight ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Storm
entries: When you deal damage to a target it can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom Modifier (minimum of once) and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Water
entries: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. If you have a swimming speed it increases by 15 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Wind
entries:
Whenever you hit a creature that is no more than 1 size larger than you with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you may choose to push it 15 feet in a horizontal direction of your choosing.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once) and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Smell of Fear
entries: You are aware of all creatures with the {@condition frightened} condition within 120 feet of you. You can't have disadvantage on attack rolls against them.

optionalfeature.name: Weatherman
entries: You may force a reroll of the weather. Additionally you are unaffected by conditions imposed due to extreme cold, wind or rain.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of Wood
entries: Whenever you crit on an attack roll you may deal an additional 1d4 poison damage. For the next minute, at the start of every turn the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Chromatic save DC or take another 1d4 poison damage. On a success the effect ends.

optionalfeature.name: Endured Suffering
entries: When you cast a spell and a creature critically fails their saving throw with a duration, the length of the spell is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Chromatic Kobold maleability
entries:
Whenever you finish a short rest in an area where a chromatic dragons presence has an effect on the environment, you may choose to change one of your Chromatic Orenth traits to one connected to that dragon type. You cannot change this trait in this way.
Additionally you more easily blend in with other kobolds. You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Charisma (Deception) checks made to convince others that you are a different kind of kobold.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Chromatic Breath Weapons
entries: Your breath weapon deals 1d10 extra damage, and you may calculate the save DC using your Wisdom modifier instead of your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Connection
entries: You can telepathically communicate with any elemental within 30 feet of you. Additionally you have advantage on Charisma checks when communicating with them.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Fighting Adept
entries: When wielding a light weapon, you may choose to use your Wisdom in place of Strength of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Spellcasting
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a spell, you may double your proficiency bonus for the attack roll or Spell Save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Mark of Tiamat
entries: Pick one of the following skills: Persuasion, Intimidation, Deception, Arcana, Nature or Religion. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Wisdom modifier instead of another ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Specific Resistance
entries: You are in touch with a specific type of magic allowing you to tap into how they work. Choose one of the schools of magic. You get advantage on saving throws against spells from that school of magic.

feature: The Ability to cast a spell from the chosen School

optionalfeature.name: Unnatural Limbs
entries: You gain an additional arm. You can grasp things with your arm, and you can use it as a snorkel. It has a reach of 5 feet, and it can lift a number of pounds equal to five times your Strength score. You can use it to do the following simple tasks: lift, drop, hold, push, or pull an object or a creature; open or close a door or a container; grapple someone; or make an unarmed strike. Your DM might allow other simple tasks to be added to that list of options. It can't wield weapons or shields or do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools or magic items or performing the somatic components of a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Call of the Sun
entries: Whenever you hit a creature you may force them to make a Charisma saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus+your Charisma modifier). On a failed save they gain the fiend creature type in addition to their normal creature type until they finish a long rest. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Summon the Sun
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a spell that creates bright light, the bright light counts as sunlight for the next hour.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Crits
entries:
Your mastery over your weapon grants you greater efficiency when perfectly striking your opponents. 
When you crit with a weapon that a Weapon Mastery Orenth trait applies to, your dice can explode, meaning when you roll maximum damage on a die you can roll an additional damage die of the same value. The amount of exploding dice rolled can technically be infinite, but after rolling an amount of exploding dice equal to your proficiency bonus you start taking the exploding damage yourself.

feature: An Orenth trait with the Weapon Mastery subtype.

optionalfeature.name: Unusual nature
entries: You don’t require food or drink.

optionalfeature.name: Physical Magic Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to magical bludgeoning/piercing/slashing damage. This resistance disappears until the end of your next turn whenever you take psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Elven Eyes
entries: You can see up to 1 mile away with no difficulty, able to discern even fine details as though looking at something no more than 100 feet away from you. Additionally the curvature of the planet you are on doesn’t interfere with your eyesight.

optionalfeature.name: Elven Suppleness
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet. You also do not leave footprints.

optionalfeature.name: Focused Expert
entries: When you pick this Orenth you lose proficiency with one skill and gain expertise in another one.

optionalfeature.name: Slow Death
entries: You cannot fail more than 1 death save per round of combat.

optionalfeature.name: The Elvenest Eyes
entries: Once per Long Rest you can ignore the maximum range of a ranged weapon you have, instead treating any creature you can see as being within range.

optionalfeature.name: Rage of the Small
entries: Your fury has turned into a rage. Your Fury of the Small damage increases to 2 times your Proficiency Bonus. In addition you can use it a number of times up to 2 times your Proficiency Bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Make em Gobble
entries: You learn to put your sharp teeth to good use. You get a bite attack which does 1d4+ Str piercing damage. In addition you also always add your Fury of the Small damage to this attack, but it is still limited to once per turn. This does not expend a use of Fury of the Small.

optionalfeature.name: Hoblin
entries: You have learned from your one syllable longer racial sibling. You are considered Hobgoblin and a Bugbear for the sake of Orenth prerequisites.

optionalfeature.name: Opportunity of the Small
entries: Your small size gives you a slight advantage against larger foes. In battle you can flank your opponent regardless of their size.

optionalfeature.name: Weird Magic
entries:
When a creature casts a spell within 60 feet of you, you may use your reaction to disturb the spell. Roll on the {@table Weird magic table|oreorenth}. The result of your roll applies to the spell cast.
You may use this trait once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Vampiric Strikes
entries: Whenever you hit with an unarmed strike you can gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. You may use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mind of the Fey
entries: You may use Wisdom or Intelligence for any Fey Orenth traits. Choose when you pick this trait.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a short rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Feywild
entries: The range of your darkvision increases by 30 feet. Additionally, while in darkness you can discern whether a creature currently has a magic effect on them. An arcana check may reveal the spell school at DMs discretion.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Blood
entries:
If you have the Fey Ancestry trait your creature type becomes fey. If your creature type is fey you gain the Fey Ancestry trait: 
You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Feywild Navigator
entries: Choose one of the following skills: Survival, Investigation, Perception, Stealth, or Nature. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Charisma modifier instead of another ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Novice Fey Bargainer
entries: Choose two of the following skills: Persuasion, Deception, Insight. You have advantage in one of these skills and disadvantage in another.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Gnome Tinkering
entries: When you use your Tinker trait you can also choose to make a machine that emulates any cantrip of your choice. You can activate this machine as an action (no matter the cantrip) while you are within 30 feet of it. The cantrip uses your Intelligence as its spellcasting ability.

optionalfeature.name: What do your gnomish eyes see?
entries: You gain 1 foot of True Sight.

optionalfeature.name: Sapphire Weapon Training
entries: Your connection to sapphire dragons provides you with the power to hone your skills with a weapon. Pick one martial weapon, you get proficiency with this weapon and your Gem traits count as Ingens Orenth traits for the purpose of gaining access to higher tier Orenth traits.

optionalfeature.name: Intuitive Gravity
entries: As a reaction to seeing a drop that would result in fall damage, you may roll the damage this fall would cause. Your character knows the value of this roll. Anything that would subsequently take this damage will use your damage roll instead of rolling for themselves.

optionalfeature.name: Subtle Magic Adept
entries: You've adapted the quiet casting of an Emerald Dragon. When you cast a cantrip you can choose to ignore verbal and somatic components. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier. You regain all uses on a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Who is who
entries: Once per long rest when you use your breath weapon you may apply an addition effect to it. Any creature that took damage from your breath gets the spell Disguise Self cast upon them as if you had cast the spell, making them look like you. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you lose concentration.

optionalfeature.name: Illusory Core
entries: This trait counts as an orenth trait of any type. Additionally you can make your other orenth abilities look like a different type using illusions.

optionalfeature.name: Emerald Fire
entries: Once per turn when you deal fire damage, you may also deal an additional 1d4 psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mental Prowess Estimation
entries:
As a bonus action you can observe the behaviour of a creature to get a sense of their mental state. Make an Intelligence (Insight) check against their Charisma score. On a success you learn which of their mental ability scores is the highest and which is the lowest, and whether they have proficiency in any mental saving throws.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: I'm pretty sure you're willing
entries: You may target an unwilling creature with a spell that requires a willing creature. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+your prof. bonus + your Intelligence modifier), on a failure, the spell is cast upon them and you may not use this feature again until you finish a long rest. On a success, you spend the spellslot but nothing happens.

optionalfeature.name: Connected to your Ancestry
entries: You gain a tier 1 trait from the Orenth type related to your original race.

optionalfeature.name: How did I die from that last time?
entries: Pick a non-physical damage type. You gain resistance to this damage.

optionalfeature.name: Undead Skill
entries: Pick one of the following skills: Athletics, Medicine, History, Arcana, Religion, Nature. You gain proficiency in the skill and you can use Constitution instead of the normal ability whenever you make a skill check.

optionalfeature.name: Send them to Sardior
entries:
Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points you may choose to have one of the following things happen, depending on the creature's alignment. You may choose which alignment if the creature has multiple, such as Chaotic Good. 
Good: Any creature of your choice within 15 feet of the creature that died gains temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier. 
Evil: Any creature of your choice within 15 feet of the creature that died takes necrotic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. 
Neutral: A creature of your choice within 30 feet of the creature that died can cast a cantrip with a casting time of one action, as a reaction. 
Chaotic: A creature of your choice within 30 feet of the creature that must immediately use its reaction to make a melee attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. 
Unaligned: A familiar appears in the dead creature's space as if you had cast find familiar. The familiar is undead and remains for 10 minutes. 
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest. After the effect ends the soul of the creature safely passes to Sardior.

optionalfeature.name: Orenth Sense
entries: As a bonus action you can sense what Orenth type a creature is most aligned to and what Orenth traits they have.

optionalfeature.name: Post Mortem Estimator
entries: As an action you can somewhat accurately determine the time that has passed since a creature has died, rounded to an amount of time the DM thinks sounds right at the time. For example, 134 years dead would give you an estimate of 100 years, 25 seconds dead would give you an estimation of 30 seconds dead.

optionalfeature.name: Increased Entropy
entries: Whenever you take fire damage your speed increases by 15 feet until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Play Dead
entries: Once per long rest you may cast Feign Death on yourself a reaction to taking damage.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Life
entries: While taking a short rest you may take the hit dice of a willing creature who is also taking a short rest and roll them to regain your own hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Reach
entries: At the start of your turn you can choose to telekinetically fling your weapon across the battlefield. Until the end of your turn your reach becomes 30 feet. You may use this trait a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Projectiles
entries: Once per turn when you hit with a ranged weapon or spell attack you may choose to pull the creature 10 feet towards you. You may do this a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sapping Strikes
entries: Choose a melee weapon that has no properties that you have proficiency with. Whenever you hit a creature with this weapon, it is unable to regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Telekinetic Weapon
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature that is no more than 1 size larger than you with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you may choose to push it 15 feet in a horizontal direction of your choosing. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier, and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gem Kobold maleability
entries:
Whenever you finish a short rest in an area where a gem dragons presence has an effect on the environment, you may choose to change one of your Gem Orenth traits to one connected to that dragon type. You cannot change this trait in this way.
Additionally you more easily blend in with other kobolds. You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Charisma (Deception) checks made to convince others that you are a different kind of kobold.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Gem Breath Weapons
entries: Your breath weapon deals 1d10 extra damage, and you may calculate the save DC using your Intelligence modifier instead of your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Gem Shell Defense
entries: You gain resistance to one of the following damage types (choose when you pick this trait): necrotic, psychic, force, thunder or radiant.

optionalfeature.name: Telepathic Link
entries: As an action, you can psionically link yourself to a willing creature you share a language with. For the next hour, you can mentally communicate with them as long as you are on the same plane of existence. You may use this feature once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Information Gatherer
entries: Pick one of the following skills: Stealth, Medicine, Insight, Perception, Crafting or Persuasion. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Intelligence modifier instead of another ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Fighting Adept
entries: When wielding a light weapon, you may choose to use your Intelligence in place of Strength of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Spellcasting
entries: Once per long rest you may change the saving throw of a spell you cast to an Intelligence saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Cooling Ears
entries: Because of your big ears you are able to cool off quickly, giving you resistance to fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Partial Retraction
entries: You can partially retract yourself into your shell, which will still allow you to move at half your speed.

optionalfeature.name: Giant's Heritage
entries: The strength of the giants flows within you. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. You have can also easily acclimate to cold climates and heights.

optionalfeature.name: Craft of the Giants
entries:
Your connection to giants grants you the power to forge and create. Depending on the type of Giant you are connected to you choose one proficiency in an associated tool. If you already have proficiency with this tool your Proficiency Bonus is doubled. 

Fire: Smith’s Tools
Cloud: Gaming Set
Frost: Cobbler’s Tools, Leatherworker’s Tools
Stone: Mason’s Tools 
Hill: Cook’s Utensils
Storm: Navigator’s Tools, Cartographer’s Tools, Water Vehicles

optionalfeature.name: Sturdiness of the Earth
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being pushed or knocked prone, and only get moved half the distance when forcefully moved against your will.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Sprinters
entries: You gain the ability to sprint across the battlefield. Whenever you dash you may choose to move with extreme speed, this also uses up your regular movement. You move three times your movement speed, but the movement must be in a straight line and unobstructed by difficult terrain. While dashing in this way opportunity attacks against you have advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Touched by the Waves
entries: You can give a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus the ability to breathe underwater, including you. You may change these creatures after every short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Octopus Camouflage
entries: After you spend a long rest in a town you can choose to resemble the local race.

optionalfeature.name: Fearsome Accuracy
entries: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with and that has the Thrown property. As an attack, you may throw your weapon at a creature at the very limit of your range. Make an attack roll against a creature exactly the maximum distance of your range away. If the attack hits, the creature takes normal damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus + the ability score you used for the attack). On a failure, the creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. They may repeat the saving throw at the end of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Deflective Weapons
entries: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that you can dual-wield. While dual-wielding with this weapon you may use a reaction after being attacked to roll a d4 and add the result to your Armor Class until the end of the attacker’s turn.

optionalfeature.name: Grinding Halt
entries: Choose a melee weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Heavy or Reach property. Whenever you must make a saving throw to avoid being moved against your will, you can dig your weapon into the ground as a reaction. Roll 2d6 and add the number rolled to the saving throw. If the effect pushing you does not have a saving throw, you move 5 feet fewer.

optionalfeature.name: Applicable Weapon Mastery
entries: After you finish a long rest you may apply any Weapon Mastery Orenth trait to a different weapon that meets the requirements.

optionalfeature.name: Spellcasting Weapons
entries: You can choose one weapon you are proficient with and use it as a spellcasting focus.

optionalfeature.name: Blowgun Expert
entries: Whenever you use a blowgun it deals 1d4 + your Dexterity modifier amount of piercing damage. Additionally it gains the Light property.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Tosser
entries: Choose a weapon you have proficiency with, with the Thrown property. The normal and long distances you can throw this weapon doubles.

optionalfeature.name: What do you mean magic?
entries: Whenever you deal damage that triggered due to you hitting with a weapon attack, you can make the damage type the same as your weapon damage.

optionalfeature.name: Crushing Blow
entries: Choose a melee weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Heavy property. As an action you can make a single weapon attack with this weapon, on a hit the target's AC is reduced by 1 until it finishes a Short Rest. Its AC can't be reduced below 10+its Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Mixed Ancestry
entries: You gain access to all Orenth types and this trait counts as a Tier 1 trait for any type.

optionalfeature.name: The Human Spirit
entries: Your human spirit grants you hope unlike any other. After you finish a long rest you get a point of inspiration.

optionalfeature.name: Stubborn
entries: You know what you like and don’t need anything else. You gain the ability to pick the same Orenth trait twice.

optionalfeature.name: Homing Minotaur
entries: You know where you come from, and more importantly how to get back. Once per long rest you can select a point or object you can see within 30 feet. Until you use this feature again you can always find your way back to this point or object.

optionalfeature.name: Continued Assault
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a weapon attack you can mark it. The next creature that damages the creature you marked takes extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus and regain all uses after a long rest. If you make a critical hit you do not need to expend a use.

optionalfeature.name: Mirage Resistance
entries: Travelling as a nomad through the desert has left you especially well equipped against the illusions of the desert and its dragons. You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against illusion spells.

optionalfeature.name: Tiny Sneaky Steps
entries: You can hide while travelling at a normal and slow pace, and do an activity at the same time.

optionalfeature.name: Brass Magic Initiate
entries: You learn the message cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Cacti Gatherer
entries: Whenever you take piercing damage, you may subtract your proficiency bonus from the damage.

optionalfeature.name: Clouds of Shade
entries: As an action, while travelling outside you are able to create a number of small magical clouds equal to your proficiency bonus and assign each of these clouds to a creature of your choice. These creatures have advantage on saving throws against Extreme Heat, as well as saving throws made to avoid taking fire and lightning damage. You can dismiss the clouds at will.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Item Conversations
entries: You are able to distinguish the emotional state of any magic item and make a Wisdom (Insight) check to determine what may have caused this emotional state. The DC is determined by the DM and depends on the power of the magic item.

optionalfeature.name: Sleep Breath Resistance
entries: Magic cannot put you to sleep. Additionally you can cast the sleep spell once per long rest, using your Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

optionalfeature.name: Innate Knowledge
entries: You can learn about the history of a place simply by staying within the area for an hour. You may attempt to make history checks about a location without having any prior knowledge about it.

optionalfeature.name: Bronze Magic Initiate
entries: You learn the resistance cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Funne man
entries: Whenever you make a pun you can give a creature that laughed temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses after a Long Rest. You can still make puns even if you have no more uses remaining.

optionalfeature.name: Copper Magic Initiate
entries: You learn the guidance cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Skill
entries: After a long rest you may choose to one of your skill or tool proficiencies and a creature of your choice that you can see. This creature gains that skill proficiency until you designate it or another creature a skill.

optionalfeature.name: Gold Magic Initiate
entries: You learn the light cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

optionalfeature.name: I am the Light
entries: Whenever you are blinded, darkness spreads around you. While the condition lasts you have the Darkness spell cast centered on you. If the spell is dispelled you are no longer blinded.

optionalfeature.name: Silver Magic Initiate
entries: You learn the prestidigitaiton cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

optionalfeature.name: Silver Spellcasting
entries: When you cast a beneficial spell on an ally you may also give them a number of temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses at the end of Long Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Metallic Kobold Maleability
entries:
Whenever you finish a short rest in an area where a metallic dragons presence has an effect on the environment, you may choose to change one of your Metallic Orenth traits to one connected to that dragon type. You cannot change this trait in this way.
Additionally you more easily blend in with other kobolds. You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Charisma (Deception) checks made to convince others that you are a different kind of kobold.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Metallic Breath Weapons
entries: Your breath weapon deals 1d10 extra damage, and you may calculate the save DC using your Charisma modifier instead of your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Metallic Fighting Adept
entries: When wielding a light weapon, you may choose to use your Charisma in place of Strength of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Humanoid Guide
entries: Choose one of the following skills: Crafting, Arcana, Religion, History, Medicine or Nature. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Charisma modifier instead of another ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Blood
entries: Your creature type becomes Celestial and when you cast the light cantrip you can have two lights active.

optionalfeature.name: Hands of Greater Healing
entries: You may roll d6s instead of d4s whenever you use your Healing Hands ability.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Celestial Revelation
entries:
You gain the following benefit, depending on your chosen revelation: 
Necrotic Shroud: You can frighten creatures up to 20 feet away and you may deal radiant damage instead of necrotic damage. 
Radiant Consumption: The aura’s size increases to 20 feet and you can choose to exclude a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier, who won’t take the damage. 
Radiant Soul: Your flying speed increases by 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: True Helper
entries: You can take the help action even if you have no proficiency in the skill or tool.

optionalfeature.name: Merciful Warrior
entries: Any damage you deal can be non-lethal. Additionally you have advantage on Wisdom (Medicine) checks to stabilize a creature.

optionalfeature.name: Trench Coat
entries: You have (or find) a buddy on whose shoulders you stand and together you pass as a larger humanoid. You gain the following benefits: You have advantage on saving throws made against being charmed; You have disadvantage on saving throws made to avoid being knocked prone; You gain additional hit points equal to your level; When you drop to 0 hit points your buddy dies instead of you and you revert back to your untrenchcoated form. You lose this trait and can pick a different trait that you apply for.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Casting
entries: Choose a spell that you can cast with a casting time of an Action. Once per Long Rest you may cast this spell as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Mastered Teleportation
entries: Choose a spell that allows you to teleport. Whenever you cast this spell you may double the distance you can teleport with it.

optionalfeature.name: Equinox
entries: Around the equinoxes, the days and nights are balanced and last equally long. Whenever you fail a d20 check you made with disadvantage, you may add 1d4 to your next d20 check.

optionalfeature.name: Painting Eggs
entries: You gain proficiency with Painters Supplies. Additionally, over the course of a short rest you can paint eggs with a pretty pattern and give them to your friends. As a reaction to failing a d20 during the next day they made look at the egg and roll 1d4 and add it to the check, possibly turning it into a success. You can make a number of eggs equal to your Wisdom modifier every short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Rope Capture
entries:
On your turn you may use 15 feet of rope to wrap a creature up. You must use your movement to fully loop around the creature, ending the movement in the place you started. You can then use your bonus action to try and tighten the rope and restrain the creature. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Dexterity modifier. The target succeeds automatically if it’s Huge or larger. On a failed save, the target has the Restrained condition until it unentangles itself. To escape, the target must use its action to make a DC 10 Strength (Athletics) check, escaping on a success.
A creature within 5 feet of the target can use its action to attempt the same thing. Destroying the rope (AC 10; 5 HP; immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage) also frees the target, ending the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Chug! Chug! Chug!
entries: You can drink a healing potion as a bonus action and still restore all the maximum amount of hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Channel the Weather
entries:
Once per turn when you hit with a weapon attack while outside, you may apply one of the following benefits, depending on the current weather: 
Heat: Your attack deals an additional 1d6 fire damage
Cold: Your attacks deal an additional 1d6 cold damage
Wind: After hitting with a weapon attack you may immediately move 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. This movement doesn't cost you any movement. 
Rain: Your attacks deal an additional 1d6 acid damage. 
Storm: At the start of the day pick either the Wind or Rain benefit.

optionalfeature.name: Harvest of the Land
entries: When performing the Foraging travelling activity and you find enough food for your party, you can give your party an additional benefit in addition to a full stomach. Anyone that eats from the food you find may add your Wisdom modifier to one of the hit dice they roll to regain hitpoints.

optionalfeature.name: Amethyst Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled transmutation spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Crystal Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled divination spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Jade Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled enchantment spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Emerald Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled illusion spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Sapphire Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled abjuration spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Topaz Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled necromancy spell you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Absorbant Recovery
entries: Once per short rest when you take damage that you are resistant to you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Pious Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you gain piety you may also regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Life Absorption
entries: Once per long rest when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell you cast, you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Trans Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you may spend 8 hours trancing during a short rest and regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Unlucky Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you roll a natural 1 on a d20 check you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: No Energy Wasted
entries: Once per long rest when a creature succeeds on a saving throw against a spell you cast resulting in nothing happening, you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Recovery in a Moment of Peace
entries: Once per long rest when you get grappled, restrained, stunned, exhausted, charmed, frightened, slowed, dazed or paralyzed against your will you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Mind and Body Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you regain hit points from a levelled spell you also regain a first level spell.

optionalfeature.name: Feywild Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you teleport you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Recovery from beyond the Grave
entries: Once per short rest when you are reduced to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Gish Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you crit with a weapon attack you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Tinkerer's Recovery
entries: Over the course of a long rest your may imbue an item with the arcane energy. Before you next long rest you may unleash the energy inside the item as a bonus action to regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Ritual Recovery
entries: Once per long rest you may perform a 10 minute ritual to enhance your power. At the end of the ritual one of your first level spellslots becomes one level higher.

optionalfeature.name: Recovery of the Breath
entries: Once per long rest when you use your Breath Weapon you may regain a first level spellslot. The orenth type of this trait depends on the type of dragonborn you are.

optionalfeature.name: Mind over Body Recovery
entries: Once per long rest during a short rest when you regain hitpoints from rolling hit dice you may refrain from adding your constitution modifier to the roll and regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Extraplanar Recovery
entries: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduces an abberation, fiend or fey to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Lunar Recovery
entries: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduce an elemental, undead, celestial or dragon to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Recovery from Nature
entries: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduce a plant, beast or ooze to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Murderous Recovery
entries: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduce a humanoid or giant to 0 hit points, you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemical Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you consume a potion you may also regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Wilderness Recovery
entries: Once per long rest while travelling you may forgo choosing a travelling activity and instead spend the day focusing on your arcane energy, regaining a first level spellslot at the end of the day.

optionalfeature.name: Overcharged Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you upcast a spell you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Ancestral Recovery
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a racial or orenth spell you may regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Chaos Breath
entries:
Your Breath Weapon trait is replaced with the following trait:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-foot line that is 4 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8+ your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save they take 1d4 fire, lightning, poison, acid and cold damage, or half as much on a successful save. This damage increases to 1d6 at 5th level, 1d8 at 11th level and 1d12 at 17th level.
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Knight of Chaos
entries: Whenever you take fire, lightning, poison, acid or cold damage you may use your reaction to make a weapon attack against a target other than the source of the damage. If you hit you deal an additional 1d4 damage of the damage that you took. You may use this reaction a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Rest
entries: During a short rest you and any creature of your choice become resistant to two of the following damage types: fire, lightning, poison, acid or cold, as long as they remain within 300 feet of where you are taking your rest.

feature: No other Rest Traits and 10+ piety with Tiamat

optionalfeature.name: Frightening Breaths
entries: Whenever a creature fails their saving throw against your Breath Weapon by 5 or more they become frightened of you for the next minute. They may repeat their saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Gold Hoarder
entries: For every 1000 gold pieces worth of coins you have in your possession, you gain a +1 bonus to Charisma ability checks, to a maximum of your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Molten Breath
entries: Whenever you use your breath weapon you leave a trail of melting ground behind. For the next round, any creature that enters the breath’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes 1d10 fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Knight of Flame
entries: The damage from your Warrior of Flame trait increases to 3d6. Additionally you gain an aura of heat around you. Whenever a creature comes within 10 feet of you, you may use your reaction to deal fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus to them. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all uses on a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Red Rest
entries: Your evil emanates from you while you rest. While taking a short rest celestials and good aligned creatures within a range of 300 feet have their maximum hit points lowered by an amount equal to your Proficiency bonus times your Wisdom modifier. As soon as you or them leave this area the reduction ends.

optionalfeature.name: Extreme Heat
entries: Once per long rest when you deal fire damage, treat immunity as resistance instead and resistance as nothing.

optionalfeature.name: Furnaced Fire
entries: Whenever you deal fire damage to a creature you may choose to apply the effect of Heat Metal to a metal object they are wearing or have on them too. The effect lasts until the start of your next turn. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Power from Destruction
entries: At the end of your turn you may count the total number of damage dice you dealt. You regain hit points equal to this amount. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Nightmare Breath
entries: Any creature that fails its saving throw against your breath weapon is frightened of you. They can repeat the save at the end of their turns, ending the effect on a failure.

optionalfeature.name: Knight of Spores
entries: The damage from your Warrior of Spores trait increases to 2d8 and the radius increases by 5 feet to a total of 10 feet. Additionally the creatures become frightened of you and one another. They can repeat the save at the end of their turns, ending the effect on a failure.

feature:
{@optfeature Warrior of Spores|chromaticorenth},
Tier 1 Fey Trait

optionalfeature.name: Deep Rest
entries: Creatures around the area where you spend your short rest become more easily frightened and poisoned. Every creature that comes within 300 feet of where you spend your short rest becomes vulnerable to poison damage and gains disadvantage on saving throws against the Poisoned and Frightened condition. You and any creatures of your choice are immune to these effects. The effect ends as you or the creature leaves the area.

feature: No other Rest Traits and a Tier 1 Fey Orenth Trait

optionalfeature.name: Knight of Storm
entries: Your attacks become charged. Whenever you hit a creature with an attack roll you may also use your reaction to deal additional lightning damage equal to your Wisdom modifier to a creature within 5 feet of them.

optionalfeature.name: Nightmare Spores
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation in a 15-foot cone. The save DC for this breath is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. Any creature in the cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. They may repeat the saving throw at the end of their turns. You may use this feature once per Long Rest.

feature: A tier 1 Fey Orenth trait, Deep Dragonborn.

optionalfeature.name: Zapping Breath
entries: Instead of breathing your breath in a straight line you may instead target any number of creatures, but the total distance the lightning travels can’t supercede the length of your breath weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Blue Rest
entries: During a short rest small illusions start appearing around you to dissuade unwanted visitors. These illusions are equivalent to up to 1 casting of Major Image and a number of castings of the silent image spell equal to your Wisdom modifier within 300 feet of where you are taking your long rest, using your Wisdom as the spellcasting ability. As soon as you leave this area the effects end.

optionalfeature.name: Muscle Spasm
entries: Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature you can immediately force it to use its reaction to make a melee attack against a random creature within its reach. You can use ability a number of times equal to your Wisdom Modifier and you regain all expended uses on a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Overcharged
entries: Once per long rest when you deal lightning damage, treat immunity as resistance instead and resistance as nothing.

optionalfeature.name: Corrosive Breath
entries: The armor class of a creature decreases by 1 whenever they fail their saving throw against your breath. Their armor class returns to normal after a Short Rest.

optionalfeature.name: Knight of Water
entries: Your swimming speed increases by an additional 15 feet. Additionally while underwater your attacks deal an additional 1d6 acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Black Rest
entries: The water fouls in the area around where you are taking a short rest. Whenever a creature within 300 feet of you starts its turn touching natural water it takes 1d6 acid damage. If the creature is fully submerged it takes 2d6 acid damage. You and any creatures of your choice are immune to this effect. The effect ends as soon as you leave the area.

optionalfeature.name: Weakness Exploitation
entries: A creature takes the maximum amount of damage whenever they critically fail on their saving throw against a damage-dealing spell you cast.

optionalfeature.name: Pure Acid
entries: Once per long rest when you deal acid damage treat immunity as resistance instead and resistance as nothing.

optionalfeature.name: The Winds are on my Side.
entries: You get the benefits of the {@optfeature Grinding Halt|ingensorenth} Orenth Trait. Whenever you use the feature you may make the creature that pushed you make the saving throw also. On a failure they are pushed the distance away from you instead. Any other effects that result from the saving throw still only apply to you.

optionalfeature.name: Fungal Fear
entries: You get the benefits of the {@optfeature Fearsome Accuracy|ingensorenth} trait. Additionally whenever you hit a creature at the edge of your range you deal an additional 1d6 psychic damage to them.

feature: Exclusive and a tier 1 Fey Orenth trait

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Fighting Expert
entries: If you have advantage on the attack roll and you hit, you may deal an additional 1d4 damage. The damage type of this extra damage can either be fire, lightning, poison, acid or cold (choose when you pick this trait).

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Deflection
entries: You gain the benefits of the {@optfeature Deflective Weapons|ingensorenth} Orenth trait. Whenever you make a saving throw to avoid taking Elemental Damage, you may also use your reaction to roll the dice and add it to your saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Freezing Breath
entries: Whenever you use your breath weapon it leaves a trail of icy ground. For the next round, any creature that enters the breath’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there needs to make a dexterity save against your breath DC. On a failure they fall prone.

optionalfeature.name: Knight of Wind
entries: The distance you can push a creature using your Warrior of Wind trait increases by 15 feet, and you may push the creature up to 20 feet vertically as well.

optionalfeature.name: White Rest
entries: Strong winds surround your place of rest. While you are taking a short rest, strong winds blow outward from your resting place. Any creature within 300 feet of where you are taking your rest that attempts to come closer to you must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot moved. You and any creature of your choice are immune to this effect.

optionalfeature.name: Biting cold
entries: Once per long rest when you deal cold damage treat immunity as resistance instead and resistance as nothing.

optionalfeature.name: Knight of Wood
entries: The damage from your Warrior of Wood trait increases to 1d6. Additionally you have advantage on attack rolls against poisoned creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Vine Grapple
entries: When you grapple a creature you may choose to restrain them too until the end of the grapple. While the grapple persists you also have a speed of 0. You may grapple a creature in this way a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Poisonous Cloud
entries: Instead of breathing your breath in a straight line you can choose to spit out a poisonous cloud instead. Any creature within 10 feet of a point you can see within 60 feet becomes the target on your breath weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Green Rest
entries: Vegetation grows wild around where you take your short rest. Within 300 feet of where you are taking your rest, plants become difficult terrain. Additionally as an action you may attempt to grapple a creature that is in this difficult terrain, using your Wisdom in place of Strength for the attack roll and save DC. These effects end as soon as you leave the area.

optionalfeature.name: Suffering Without End
entries: Once per long rest when you cast a spell that has repeated saving throws to end an effect, you choose to especially torture a single target of the spell. If they fail the initial save they automatically fail all other saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Evolved Poison
entries: Once per long rest when you deal poison damage, treat immunity as resistance instead and resistance as nothing.

optionalfeature.name: Exhaustive Poison
entries: Whenever you give a creature the poisoned condition, you also give them one level of exhaustion that lasts until the poisoned condition ends.

optionalfeature.name: Control of the Woods
entries: You can cast enlarge/reduce as an action without expending a spellslot as long as you are targetting a plant. You use Wisdom as your spellcasting ability.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Chromatic Warding
entries: You may now use your Chromatic Warding ability twice per long rest. Additionally you may deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus whenever you deal damage while your Chromatic Warding is active. You may do this once per turn, and the damage type is the one associated with your ancestry.

optionalfeature.name: Back to Basics
entries: You return to a more primal version of yourself. You get the Pack Tactics feature, granting advantage against enemies while an ally is within 5 feet of the opponent. In addition, you get Sunlight Sensitivity, giving disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom(Perception) checks while you or the target is in direct sunlight.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Defyance
entries:
Your connection to your Orenth has granted you a greater resistance to magic.
You gain advantage on saving throws against spells you currently have prepared and resistance against spells you currently have prepared.

optionalfeature.name: Uneasy Unevennes
entries: Whenever dice are rolled for damage within 60 feet of you, you can use your reaction to increase or decrease the dice size by one. For example, if the damage is 4d10, you now roll 4d11. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sun Poisoning
entries: You stare at someone with the sickening intensity of the sun as a bonus action. They must make a Constitution saving throw (DC=8+proficiency bonus+your Wisdom) or their strength attacks deal half damage for the next minute. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on a success. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Careful Thinker
entries: You can decide to take ten times as much time for an ability check as it would normally take. When you make the check you may treat any number rolled lower than a thrice your proficiency bonus as if you rolled a value equal to thrice your proficiency bonus instead. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses after you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Light as Air
entries: You become resistant to fall damage. You can use creatures of your size as mounts.

optionalfeature.name: Rest of Il Fusto
entries: While taking a short rest you channel the healing energy of Il Fusto. Within 300 feet of you Fusto Berries start growing. You can spend 10 minutes to make a DC12 Wisdom (Survival) check. Each creature in the area can attempt this check once. On a success you find 1d4 Fusto berries. You cannot regain more hit points than your level from eating Fusto berries in one day. For the next 24 hours you do not age and you are immune to effects that increase your age.

optionalfeature.name: Elvenier Eyes
entries: You get Expertise in Perception

optionalfeature.name: Wilderness Trance
entries: While taking a short rest out in the wilderness you are able to perform a travel activity. You can perform this activity without leaving your camp for too long.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Mind
entries: You are immune to the charmed condition.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Strategy
entries: Once per long rest, as an action, you can utter a special command or warning. For the next minute, whenever a nonhostile creature that you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll or a saving throw, the creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand you. This effect ends if you are incapacitated.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Weird Magic
entries: You may now roll on the {@table Weird magic table|oreorenth} twice and pick which of the two effects you want to make happen. Additionally you may use it once per short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Annis Hag's Hugs
entries: Whenever you grapple a creature you may also deal bludgeoning damage to the creature at the end of your turns. You deal damage equal to your Strength modifier plus your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Green Hag's Voice
entries: You can perfectly replicate any sound you’ve heard before. Additionally you can throw your voice to originate from any point within 60 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Sea Hag's Glare
entries:
As a bonus action you may glare at a creature within 15 feet of you that can see you. They must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus+your Charisma modifier), on a failure they become frightened of you for the next minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to your glare for the next 24 hours.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Night Hag's Bag
entries: As a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you is reduced to 0 hit points you may trap their soul in your magical bag. As an action you can consume the soul, regaining a number of hit points equal to twice the creature’s CR (rounded up).

optionalfeature.name: Bheur Hag's Graystaff
entries: One quarterstaff of your choice becomes your Graystaff. While you have it on your body you are under the effects of the featherfall spell. Additionally once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon you may reduce their speed by 10 feet. Only you can benefit from the benefits of your Graystaff. You may make a different quarterstaff your Graystaff at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Photosynthesis
entries: Your skin becomes bright green. You become resistant to radiant damage and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier whenever you start your turn in sunlight.

optionalfeature.name: No reflection
entries: You no longer show up in divination magic and you have no reflection. Additionally, you may use your Charisma instead of your Dexterity whenever you make a Stealth check.

optionalfeature.name: Grabby Goblin Hands
entries: Choose a Light melee weapon you have proficiency with, or your Unarmed Strikes. Once per turn when you hit with a weapon attack, you gain the Hold On condition to the target. The target must be at least one size larger than you.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Steps
entries: You can use your movement and bonus action to teleport. You can teleport to any place you would normally be able to move with your movement, ignoring difficult terrain. Creatures can make an opportunity attack against you when you teleport away from them.

feature: The ability to teleport in some way

optionalfeature.name: Expert Fey Bargainer
entries: Roll 2d6 and 1d4 and consult the [@table Fey Bargain Table|oreorenth}. You gain vulnerability to the first damage type you rolled and resistance to the second, you gain resistance to the damage type you rolled with the d4. If you had resistance to a damage type that you now gained a vulnerability to, they cancel out. Whenever you get a new Orenth trait you can choose to reroll all three.

optionalfeature.name: Minor Magic item Creator
entries: Over the course of a short rest you can turn an item into a common magic item. The item must match the common magic item. You can have one such magic item at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Collaborative Steps
entries: Whenever you teleport you may take one additional willing creature within 5 feet of you with you.

feature: The ability to teleport in some way

optionalfeature.name: Paths of the Feywild
entries: At the start of your turn remember where you are standing. As a reaction at the end of another creature's turn you may teleport back to this spot. You may use this reaction a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Momentum Calculation
entries:
After hitting with a weapon attack you may use your reaction to make an Intelligence (Arcana) check against the AC of the creature you hit. On a success your weapon automatically deals max damage and you expend a use of this feature. On a failure nothing happens.
Any smites, sneak attack bonuses, spells or other damage increasing effects are not maximised. But, if for example you have a magical weapon that deals an additional 1d6 fire damage, this would be maximised.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fortitude Mimicry
entries: As an action you resemble a creature you can see within range a little more. You gain immunity to two conditions they have immunity to of your choice for the next minute. You may use this action a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Singularity Breath
entries:
You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally once per Long Rest you may apply the following effect to your breath in addition to the damage:
Each creature that failed their saving throw has their speed reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Shattering Shard Sling
entries: Whenever you hit a creature with a sling attack, you deal an additional 1d4 force damage to the creature you hit and any creature within 5 feet of it.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Disruptor
entries: You deal an additional 1d8 force damage against aberrations fiends, fey, celestials and elementals.

optionalfeature.name: Amethyst Spellcasting
entries: Once per Short Rest when you cast a spell of first level or higher from the Transmutation school you regain a first level spellslot.

optionalfeature.name: Amethyst Spit
entries: Whenever you use your Breath weapon, you may instead choose to spit an exploding amethyst crystal. It lands at a point you can see within 30 feet and any creature within 10 feet of the crystal must make a Dexterity saving throw or take the damage from your Breath Weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Flash Forward
entries: Sometimes the future is uncertain, and you are able to steer the course of time into the result you desire. When you or a creature within 30 feet of you rolls damage you may roll twice and pick which one as reaction. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier. You regain all uses on a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Crystal Rest
entries:
Being prepared is important, definitely when you’re trying to rest. When you start taking a short rest, the DM chooses an omen to send you.
Positive:. Something positive is likely to happen during your rest.
Negative: Something negative is likely to happen during your rest.
Neutral: Nothing necessarily positive or negative is likely to happen during your rest. 
Uncertain: Something is likely to happen during your rest, but the outcome of the situation can turn out either positive or negative.

optionalfeature.name: Synced Rejuvination
entries: Whenever a monster you can see regains the use of a rechargable ability (by rolling a 5/6 on a d6) you may regain a number of hit points equal to a roll of one of your hit dice + your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Guided by the Stars
entries: Once per long rest you and your party can travel throughout the night without gaining a level of exhaustion. This counts as an additional day of travel and you don't suffer any disadvantages from travelling at night.

optionalfeature.name: Disorienting Breath
entries:
You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally once per Long Rest you may apply the following effect to your breath in addition to the damage:
Each creature that fails their saving throw is forced to subtract 1d6 from all their attack rolls and ability checks until the end of their next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Emerald Rest
entries: During a short rest, you are magically hidden. Any creature that is unaware of your presence that tries to get within 300 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus+your Intelligence modifer). On a failed save they come no closer and move around your resting area without learning of your presence. On a successful save they continue their original path. This effect ends when you leave this 300 foot area.

optionalfeature.name: Unseen Step
entries:
Your connection to Emerald dragons has led you to be good at being unheard and unseen. Whenever you take the Hide Action and successfully hide, you can choose to become invisible as a part of that action instead. While invisible you also do not make any sound. Your invisibility ends after one minute or if you take the Magic or Attack action.
You may use this ability once per short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Subtle Magic Expert
entries: Whenever you cast a spell you may choose to ignore its somatic and verbal components. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once) and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Euphoria Breath
entries:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC=8+your Constitution modifier + your prof. Bonus), or for 1 minute, the target can’t take reactions and must roll a d6at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn:
1–4: The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction.
5–6: The target doesn’t move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success
You may use this ability once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Jade Rest
entries: Time becomes messy when you take your rest. Any creature that comes within 300 feet of where you are taking your short rest must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failure they must roll on the {@table Messed Up Time Table|oreorenth}, experiencing the effect. Any creatures of your choice that you are aware of are immune to the effect. The effects end as soon as they or you leave the area.

feature: No other Rest Traits and a Tier 1 Fey Orenth Trait

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Breath
entries:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC=8+your Constitution modifier + your prof. Bonus), or they are charmed by you for one minute. While charmed in this way they cannot lie to you. Undead cannot be immune to this charm.
You may use this ability once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Undead Understanding
entries: Whenever an Undead creature tries to attack you it must first succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, the undead must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This Ability doesn’t protect you from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball. If you have attacked the undead it has advantage on its saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Can't die again
entries: Whenever you fail a saving throw that deals enough damage to reduce you to 0 hit points, you may reroll it.

optionalfeature.name: A bit more dead than alive
entries: Your creature type becomes undead. If damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

optionalfeature.name: Undead Pals
entries: As an action you may choose an undead with a CR equal to or lower than your proficiency bonus that you can see within 30 feet of you. It must see and hear you. If the undead's Intelligence is 11 or higher, the spell fails. Otherwise, the undead must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for an hour. While charmed in this way it becomes non-hostile to your and allies of your choosing. If you or one of your companions harms the target, the effect ends.

optionalfeature.name: Gave you a bit too much
entries: Whenever you heal a creature on your turn you may choose to give them twice the amount of hit points, but you fall unconscious until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Wait, I remember you...
entries: You may cast Charm Person a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier per long rest, using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. When you cast the spell in this way it requires no spell components.

optionalfeature.name: Secrets of the Allip
entries: An Allip has told you part of a great secret that has broken your mind. Whenever you fail a Wisdom, Intelligence or Charisma saving throw, you may choose to succeed instead. However, you do gain a level of exhaustion.

optionalfeature.name: What even is Reality
entries: Whenever a creature has one of the following conditions applied to them you can use your action to change it to one of the others: Deafened, Blinded, Frightened, or Restrained. The duration and additional effects still apply. You may do this once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Loosely bound Soul
entries: Once per long rest when you become incapacitated you can attempt to possess a creature within 30 feet of you. The creature must have a level equal to yours or a CR equal to or less than half your level rounded down. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failure, you have full control over them for one minute or until your incapacitated condition ends or your body dies.

optionalfeature.name: Debilitating Breath
entries:
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC=8+your Constitution modifier + your prof. Bonus) or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.
You may use this ability once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Physical Prowess Estimation
entries:
As a bonus action you can observe the physiology of a creature to get an estimate of their physical state. Make an Intelligence (Medicine) check against their Dexterity score. On a success you learn which of their physical ability scores is the highest and which is the lowest, and whether they have proficiency in any physical saving throws.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sapphire Zoologist
entries: As a bonus action you may learn the creature type of a creature you can see. This ability is not able to detect the original creature type of a creature altered by magic (such as polymorph or magic aura).

optionalfeature.name: Sapphire Rest
entries: During a short rest, creatures and plants around you become luminescent. Within 300 feet of you any plant or animal sheds dim light in a 20 foot radius that only you and your allies can see. If a creature enters this dim light, the animals and plants shed bright light for you and your allies instead. This effect ends when you leave this 300 foot area.

optionalfeature.name: Can't be outmatched
entries:
Whenever you are fighting a creature you may use your bonus action to measure your own physical ability against theirs. Choose one of the following attributes: 
Strength: If the creature's strength score is higher than yours, your Strength modifier increases by 1 for the next minute. If theirs is lower nothing happens. 
Armor Class: If the creature's Armor Class is higher than yours, your armor class increases by 2 for the next minute. If theirs is lower nothing happens. 
Number of hit dice: If you have fewer total hit dice than the creature you may immediately roll one of your hit dice and add your Constitution modifier, regaining this many hit points. You don't spend any hit dice when using this ability. If your total hit dice are lower than theirs nothing happens. 
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Biological Weakness
entries: As a Bonus Action you can make an Intelligence (nature) check about a creature you can see (DC=10+the creatures CR). On a success a 19 is also considered a critical hit against this creature for the next minute and you expend a use. On a failure nothing happens. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Desiccating Breath
entries:
You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally once per Long Rest you may apply the following effect to your breath in addition to the damage:
Each creature that fails its saving throw is weakened until the end of its next turn. A weakened creature has disadvantage on Strength-based ability checks and Strength saving throws, and the creature's weapon attacks that rely on Strength deal half damage.

optionalfeature.name: Topaz Rest
entries: During a short rest, the area around you dries up. Any creature that comes within 300 feet of where you are spending your long rest must make a Constitution saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus+your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save they gain 1 level of exhaustion. Creatures that are immune or resistant to necrotic damage automatically succeed on this saving throw. The exhaustion ends as soon as they move further than 300 feet away from the place you are spending your long rest. You may also end the effect on a creature at will. This effect ends on all creatures when you leave this 300 foot area.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Fighting Expert
entries: If you have advantage on the attack roll and you hit, you may deal an additional 1d4 damage. The damage type of this extra damage can either be force, thunder, psychic, necrotic or radiant (choose when you pick this trait).

optionalfeature.name: Improved Telepathic Link
entries: As an action, you can psionically link yourself to a willing creature you share a language with. For the next hour, you can mentally communicate with them as long as you are on the same plane of existence.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Gem Flight
entries: You may now use your Gem Flight ability twice per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Wings
entries: Your flying speed while using Gem Flight increases by 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Tortle
entries: You gain the Breath Weapon feature from the Gem Dragonborn, but you may only use it a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus rounded up. The damage type used is the same as the one you picked for Gem Shell Resilience. You also count as this type of dragonborn for the purpose of choosing Orenth traits.

optionalfeature.name: Infused Gem Lair
entries:
As a gem kobold you gain certain advantages while in Gem Dragon lairs or areas of high Orenth influence. Depending on the gem type you gain one of the following effects: 

Amethyst: You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and you can hover.
Sapphire: You gain a burrow speed equal to your walking speed. This burrow speed allows you to burrow through solid rock.
Emerald: You constantly sense magic around you, as per the Detect Magic spell.
Topaz: You start every turn with a number of temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).
Crystal: You gain a portent die whenever you roll initiative. You lose this die when combat ends.
Jade: You can become invisible as an action. Your invisibility ends when you use the Attack or Magic action.

optionalfeature.name: Shaped Breath Weapon
entries: The size of your breath weapon increases to a 30 foot cone. Additionally whenever you use your breath weapon you may choose to exhale in a 60 foot long, 5 foot wide line instead.

optionalfeature.name: Extreme Exertion
entries: Before you attempt an ability check you may force your body to exert itself beyond its normal limits. You may choose a d4, d6, d8, d10 or d12 and add the result to your ability check. Your hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the value rolled with the extra die. The reduction lasts until you fishish a short rest, during which you must be unconscious. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Imbued weapon
entries: As a bonus action you can instill your own {@table Martial abilities|oreorenth} into one of your weapons. Any creature using the weapon can use your ability as if they were you for the next minute. You may use this trait once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: In Tune with Stone
entries: Your connection to the earth allows you to sense people around you. You gain tremorsense to a range of 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Besieger
entries: You deal double damage against objects, structures and constructs.

optionalfeature.name: Constrict
entries: You can grapple a creature even if your hands aren't free.

optionalfeature.name: Hydra Heads
